formalText: Talked about how he defended his dissertation and how it went fine. It took a lot of work.
We will not meet next week and then the following week rather than the first I'll see him on the 2nd at 12:45.
And then we'll go back to Wednesdays.
He says, "So the last week has been a little bit strange"
After the congratulations of everyone and being exhausted, there was sort of some sense of loss and not going away.
The other thing was sort of  a dread of coming back.
Talked about how Tanya is still very depressed and it's hard to be around all the time.
As long as depression drags on four more years, it feels like more like it's a drain on him emotionally. He states, "there's not much else in a relationship for me besides a bleak picture of it.
He states "It is so emotionally draining to be in a relationship with someone who's depressed".
He recognizes that he has a tendency to despair about some situations and he is trying to find a realistic balance between this
He doesn't feel like there is anything more in his marriage than depression.
but he doesn't know how to answer the question of how to fix it..
"My first response is to say well, why do I feel trapped because if I can identify that then in theory I could alleviate some of those things and I think we just talked about that in some sense
She's unhappy most of the time and
I guess I feel like I don't really trust her to or the same extent at all".
He feesl trapped because he can't leave the relationship.
Tanya is talking about wanting to be a priest and so she's a little bit excited about that and a little bit terrified..
He talked about ways he works on feeling less trapped such as work and friends.
